snippet: Andrew Parker, the new head of MI5, said recent leaks have caused enormous damage to efforts to protect citizens, handing “the advantage to the terrorists.”
abstract: Andrew Parker, chief of Britain’s domestic intelligence agency MI5, says leaks about government spying capabilities have caused enormous damage, handing 'the advantage to the terrorists'; comments are harsh rejoinder to widespread criticism that American and British surveillance programs are an excessive and even illegal intrusion into personal privacy.
lead_paragraph: Andrew Parker, the new head of MI5, said recent leaks have caused enormous damage to efforts to protect citizens, handing “the advantage to the terrorists.”

headline.main: Director of British Domestic Intelligence Agency Defends Spying Policies
headline.print_headline: Director of British Domestic Intelligence Agency Defends Spying Policies
